titles.title: Supreme Court Ethics Act of 2015
A bill to require the Supreme Court of the United States to promulgate a code of ethics.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

term.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption

bill.summary:
4/23/2015--Introduced. Supreme Court Ethics Act of 2015
Requires the Supreme Court to promulgate a code of ethics for the Justices of the Supreme Court that shall include the five canons of the Code of Conduct for United States Judges adopted by the Judicial Conference of the United States, with any amendments or modifications that the Supreme Court determines appropriate.
